title: Top Places to visit in Hardoi, Uttar Pradesh
content:
Hardoi is a city and municipal board in Hardoi district in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh. It is the administrative headquarters of Hardoi district.

 

Demographics

As of 2011 India census, Hardoi city had a population of 1,30,429. Males constitute 52.59% of the population and females 47.41%. In 2011 Average literacy rate of Hardoi city was 81.67% higher than the national average of 74.9%: male literacy was 86.59%, and female literacy was 76.22%. In Hardoi, 12% of the population is under 6 years of age.

 

 

Religious Place

The temple of Maa Kaliji - which is situated in the village of Bankhariya on Harpalpur road in Sandi block of Hardoi, is very beautiful. Which is built by Shri Bharat Singh ji (former teacher). Sri Bharat Singh ji has constructed this temple for 15 years with unwavering triumph and its deposit capital. It is a very observable temple. Here comes the peace of mind after seeing the Maata Rani. You can go here anytime but if you go to the rainy season you may have a problem of mud because there is a raw path to go to the temple. The temple of BABA SUNASINATH JI is situated 3 km away from Mallawan. It is also famous and it was a natural origin of divine power in the British umpire. It is also counted in one of the oldest temple in Hardoi. The holy river GANGA is only 18 km away in south of Mallawan.

 

Agriculture

Agriculture is the main activity in the district and many people depend on it. Of the total area, 3,980.45 km2 is devoted to agriculture. The main crops are paddy, sugarcane, wheat, vegetables, pulses and oilseeds. A small proportion of the total cultivated is used for horticulture: guava, mangoes, some herbs, etc. RIVER AND GHATS TEDIYA GHAT-this ghat is situated in JUGARAJPUR village, which is located about 14 km away from atrouli town.

subContents.SubTitle: 1. Sarvan Devi Temple
subContents.SubContent: The Sarvan [SHRAVAN] Devi temple on Sandi Road is a shaktipeeth with the mythological history of having been built on the place where the ear [SHRAVAN] of the SATI fell down. Mythologically speaking it an important destination for all interested in Hindu mythology. This place is especially popular among newly-wed couples who come to seek the blessing of SATI for a happy married life. For others tourists, it is a just another temple which with its limited resources lacks the luster of other heavily financed temples. In the same complex, there are other idols too.

subContents.SubTitle: 2. Sandi Bird Sanctuary
subContents.SubContent: Sandi Bird Sanctuary is situated at a distance of 19 km on Hardoi-Sandi Road in Hardoi district of Uttar Pradesh. Sandi Bird Sanctuary is nearly 1 km. from Sandi town on Main Road, Nawabganj, near Sandi Police Station Sandi (Hardoi). Sandi Bird sanctuary was developed in the year 1990 in view to protecting the natural habitats and aquatic vegetation for the local residents and migratory birds. The Sandi Bird sanctuary is also known by its ancient name as “Dahar Jheel” (Jheel = Lake). The lake is spread over 3.0854 km2 area. River Garra earlier named as Garun Ganga also located near the sanctuary. Migratory birds rest for some time in the riverfront before reaching to Sandi Bird sanctuary. The migratory birds start coming at the beginning of winter in the month of November. As a tourist destination, Sandi is a paradise for bird lovers and is an ideal place for those who want to explore nature. The best time to visit the sanctuary is from December to February. The nearest railway station is at Hardoi (19 km).

subContents.SubTitle: 3. How to Reach
subContents.SubContent:
BY BUS

 

Hardoi is well connected to other major cities of the country via regular buses.

Bus Station(s): Hardoi

 

 

BY TRAIN

 

There are regular trains from other major cities of the country to Hardoi.

Railway Station(s): Hardoi (HRI)

 

BY FLIGHT

 

Instead of Hardoi you can a get flight to Amausi Airport on regular basis.

Hardoi

101 km away

Amausi Airport (LKO), Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh

Hardoi

108 km away

Kanpur Airport (KNU), Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh

recommendations.title: Top Places to visit in Unnao, Uttar Pradesh
recommendations.content: Unnao is the headquarters of Unnao district in Uttar Pradesh, India between Kanpur and Lucknow. Unnao is a large industrial city with three industrial suburbs around it. recommendations.title: Top Places to visit in Hathras (Mahamaya Nagar), Uttar Pradesh
recommendations.content: Hathras is an ancient city and a municipal board in Hathras district, in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh. It is the headquarters of the district that was created on 3 May 1997, by incorporating parts of: Aligarh, Mathura, Agra Districts, and Khair Tehsil. It forms a part of Aligarh Division.</p

recommendations.title: Top Places to Visit in Faizabad (Ayodhya), Uttar Pradesh
recommendations.content: Faizabad is a city in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh, and forms a municipal corporation with Ayodhya. It is the headquarters of Faizabad District and Faizabad division.
